tier.item: (i) *Eti v era pjat' devusek prislo/prisli. (change the verb accordingly??)
See Franks (1994) for further agreement differences between SC and Russian. Among other things,
Franks shows that in SC the sg option is possible even with collective verbs like gather, in contrast to Russian. This
leads him to treat agreement with SC and Russian numeral subjects differently, as discussed below.
going home five women(pl) is about that discussed(sg)
(i) *Eti v era pjat' devusek prislo/prisli. (change the verb accordingly??)
See Franks (1994) for further agreement differences between SC and Russian. Among other things,
Franks shows that in SC the sg option is possible even with collective verbs like gather, in contrast to Russian. This
leads him to treat agreement with SC and Russian numeral subjects differently, as discussed below.
going home five women(pl) is about that discussed(sg)
Eti v era pjat' devusek prislo/prisli. (change the verb accordingly??)
See Franks (1994) for further agreement differences between SC and Russian. Among other things,
Franks shows that in SC the sg option is possible even with collective verbs like gather, in contrast to Russian. This
leads him to treat agreement with SC and Russian numeral subjects differently, as discussed below.
going home five women(pl) is about that discussed(sg)
Going home, five women discussed it.
